short_description: Classifies time series data based on shapelet model.
long_description: This function classifies time series data based on shapelet model generated by SupervisedShapeletTrainer.

input_tables.name: InputTable
input_tables.rDescription: Specifies the table representing input time series data for classification.
input_tables.description: Specifies the table representing input time series data for classification.

input_tables.name: Model
input_tables.rDescription: Specifies the name of the model table that contains trained shapelets using ta.supervisedshapelet.trainer.
input_tables.description: Specifies the name of the model table that contains trained shapelets using SupervisedShapeletTrainer.

argument_clauses.name: TargetColumn
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the name of the time_series column that contains the data points in the time series. The default value_column is "value".
argument_clauses.description: Specify the name of the time_series column that contains the data points in the time series. Default: "value"

argument_clauses.name: Accumulate
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the names of the time_series columns to copy to the output table. By default, only the id and predicted_category columns are copied to the output table. Columns specified by this argument appear after the other output table columns.
argument_clauses.description: Specify the names of the time_series columns to copy to the output table. Columns specified by this argument appear after the other output table columns. Default: id and predicted_category

argument_clauses.name: TimeInterval
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the number of data points in a time series to skip between consecutive time series windows when calculating the distance of a shapelet from a time series. Because a shapelet is typically much smaller than a complete time series, the function calculates the distance of a shapelet from a time series by sliding the shapelet across time series windows of shapelet length, calculating the distance between the shapelet and each window, and then selecting the smallest distance. The num_data_points is the number of data points to skip when sliding from one time series window to the next. The num_data_points must be an INTEGER in the range [1, 1000000]. The value 1 gives optimal results at the cost of higher execution time. The default value is 10. Note: This argument must specify the same value as the ta.supervisedshapelet.trainer time.interval argument specified when it generated the shapelets table.
argument_clauses.description: Specify the number of data points in a time series to skip between consecutive time series windows when calculating the distance of a shapelet from a time series. Because a shapelet is typically much smaller than a complete time series, the function calculates the distance of a shapelet from a time series by sliding the shapelet across time series windows of shapelet length, calculating the distance between the shapelet and each window, and then selecting the smallest distance. The num_data_points is the number of data points to skip when sliding from one time series window to the next. The num_data_points must be an INTEGER in the range [1, 1000000]. The value 1 gives optimal results at the cost of higher execution time. Note: This argument must specify the same value as the ShapeletSupervised TimeInterval argument specified when it created the shapelets table. Default: 10

argument_clauses.name: UniqueId
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the LIST_VECTOR of column(s) that uniquely identifies each row of the input argument INPUT_ARG_NAME. The argument is used to ensure deterministic results for functions which produce results that vary from run to run.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the input column(s) that uniquely identify each row of input table. The format is 'input1:c1' where input1 refers to the alias used by the input table that contains such column named c1.
